DOCNAME: CASE OF DJAVIT AN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objections rejected (State responsibility, non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Not necessary to examine Art. 10;Violation of Art. 11;Violation of Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP national of NORP origin who was born in DATE and is a paediatrician residing in GPE , north of the “ green line ” .

CARDINAL . In addition to being a critic of the NORP - Cypriot authorities and of the NORP military presence in the northern part of GPE , which he defines as “ occupation ” , the applicant is the “ NORP - Cypriot coordinator ” of the Movement for an ORG , an unregistered association of NORP and NORP Cypriots founded in DATE in GPE . The movement has a NORP - Cypriot coordinating committee in the northern part of the island and a NORP - Cypriot coordinating committee in the southern part . The purpose of the ORG is to develop close relations between the CARDINAL communities . To that end , it organises bi - communal meetings of a political , cultural , medical or social character .

CARDINAL . The applicant is normally unable to obtain a permit from the NORP and NORP - Cypriot authorities to visit the “ buffer - zone ” or the southern part of the island in order to participate in various bi - communal meetings . Thus , DATE and DATE , the date of the ORG 's admissibility decision , CARDINAL out of CARDINAL requests for such permits were granted . Further , DATE and DATE CARDINAL more permits were refused , CARDINAL of which , however , was granted later on . The requests that were turned down concerned , inter alia , a ORG ( ORG in GPE ) Spring Fair at FAC in DATE , a bi - communal medical seminar organised by the ORG ( ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ) in DATE , a meeting of the coordinating committee for ORG for an ORG at FAC in DATE as well as CARDINAL meetings for the reorganisation of this committee in DATE , a seminar on cardiology organised by the ORG in DATE , a general meeting of ORG in DATE and a number of receptions organised by the NORP embassy in GPE . Moreover , in DATE the above - mentioned authorities refused to allow NORP Cypriots to attend a meeting organised by the applicant in the northern part of the island .

CARDINAL . The applicant claimed that ORG of the “ GPE ” ( the “ LOC ” ) had adopted a decision prohibiting him from contacting NORP . Reference to this decision was allegedly made in a letter dated DATE by the Health Minister of the “ NORP ” to the applicant , which reads as follows :
“ According to the information our ORG has received , you were informed by ORG orally and this has been a decision of the government and we have nothing to add in our capacity as the Ministry . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the Prime Minister of the “ NORP ” requesting to be informed of the content of ORG decision referred to in the above - mentioned letter , but received no reply .
CARDINAL . On DATE he sent a letter of protest to the Foreign Minister of GPE , which has also remained unanswered .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG and Defence of the “ NORP ” informed the applicant that “ the permission requested by [ his ] letter of DATE was refused for security reasons , in the public interest and because [ he had ] made propaganda against the State ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the Deputy Prime Minister of the “ NORP ” , asking whether the previous decision of ORG was still in force since he was not allowed to visit the buffer - zone or cross over into GPE . He received no answer and on DATE he sent a reminder , which also remained unanswered . However , the applicant claimed that , in an article published in a newspaper on DATE , the former Deputy Prime Minister ( to whom he had sent the above - mentioned letters ) had stated that when he had held this position he had requested an explanation by the Prime Minister as well as the President of the “ NORP ” in relation to the refusal of permits , but had not received an answer .
